item.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/metroid-prime-4-beyond-nintendo-switch-2-edition-announced

Publisher Nintendo and developer Retro Studios have announced Metroid Prime 4: Beyond – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition for Switch 2. It will launch in 2025.

Users who own or purchase the original game for Switch will be able to upgrade to the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition by purchasing the game’s upgrade pack from Nintendo eShop, My Nintendo Store, or retailers. After you upgrade, the original Switch game can still be played on Switch, though the features and content of the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition can only be played on Switch 2. More information is available here.

Metroid Prime 4: Beyond – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition will feature the following upgrades:

  • Support for mouse controls using Joy-Con 2 controllers.
  • Enhanced resolution, textures and load times.
  • Choose from two display modes:
    • Quality Mode runs at 60 frames per second in 4K resolution in TV mode / 1080p while in handheld mode.
    • Performance Mode runs at 120 frames per second in 1080p resolution in TV mode / 720p in handheld mode.
  • Both display modes feature HDR support.

View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/the-legend-of-zelda-tears-of-the-kingdom-nintendo-switch-2-edition-announced

Nintendo has announced The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition for Switch 2. It will launch alongside the hardware on June 5.

Users who own or purchase the original game for Switch will be able to upgrade to the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition by purchasing the game’s upgrade pack from Nintendo eShop, My Nintendo Store, or retailers. After you upgrade, the original Switch game can still be played on Switch, though the features and content of the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition can only be played on Switch 2. More information is available here.

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Wild – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition will feature the following upgrades:

  • Support for the ZELDA NOTES game-specific service via Nintendo Switch App.
  • Improved frame rates and resolution.
  • Faster load times.
  • HDR support.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nintendo:

See the Kingdom of Hyrule in a whole new way with The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition and The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition, available with performance upgrades on Nintendo Switch 2. Smoother frame rates, faster load times, and better graphics will make for a fresh experience when revisiting these adventures, and now players will also have a little extra help. Also on the way is an update to the Nintendo Switch App (previously known as the Nintendo Switch Online App), called ZELDA NOTES. This game-specific service is exclusive to the Nintendo Switch 2 Editions of the games and helps players navigate to various locations, like that difficult-to-find shrine or hidden Korok, and will even feature commentary from Princess Zelda herself that was not part of the original games.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery. Visit the official website here: Japanese.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour announced for Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/nintendo-switch-2-welcome-tour-announced-for-switch-2

  • Switch 2

Paid title due out at launch.

Nintendo has announced Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour, a paid digital-only game for Switch 2 due out alongside the hardware on June 5.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nintendo:

Explore a variety of features and details the new system has to offer. Players can enter a virtual exhibition with Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour and gain insights into what makes Nintendo Switch 2 such a unique gaming experience. Through tech demos, minigames, and other interactions, players will get to know the new system inside and out in ways they may never have known about otherwise.
